course_spec_file: Advanced Higher Computing Science Course Specification.pdf

subquestions.exam_section: SECTION 1 — SOFTWARE DESIGN AND DEVELOPMENT — 35 marks
subquestions.description: Declare a 2-D array of character values to store a game board grid using a chosen programming language.

subquestions.exam_section: SECTION 1 — SOFTWARE DESIGN AND DEVELOPMENT — 35 marks
subquestions.description: Explain the advantages of implementing a queue as a single linked list rather than a double linked list.

subquestions.exam_section: SECTION 1 — SOFTWARE DESIGN AND DEVELOPMENT — 35 marks
subquestions.description: Describe the changes to node pointers when removing the first element of a single linked list.

subquestions.exam_section: SECTION 1 — SOFTWARE DESIGN AND DEVELOPMENT — 35 marks
subquestions.description: Describe how pointers are adjusted to remove a specific middle node from a single linked list.

subquestions.exam_section: SECTION 1 — SOFTWARE DESIGN AND DEVELOPMENT — 35 marks
subquestions.description: Describe the steps required to add a new node to the end of an existing single linked list.

subquestions.exam_section: SECTION 1 — SOFTWARE DESIGN AND DEVELOPMENT — 35 marks
subquestions.description: Identify an additional actor required for a given system based on a UML use case diagram.

subquestions.exam_section: SECTION 1 — SOFTWARE DESIGN AND DEVELOPMENT — 35 marks
subquestions.description: Explain the difference between include and extend relationships within a UML use case diagram.

subquestions.exam_section: SECTION 1 — SOFTWARE DESIGN AND DEVELOPMENT — 35 marks
subquestions.description: Describe the effect of code that instantiates an object and initialises its properties using object-oriented terminology.

subquestions.exam_section: SECTION 1 — SOFTWARE DESIGN AND DEVELOPMENT — 35 marks
subquestions.description: Implement a class method to calculate a value based on the average of several object properties.

subquestions.exam_section: SECTION 1 — SOFTWARE DESIGN AND DEVELOPMENT — 35 marks
subquestions.description: Explain the purpose of code used to declare and initialise an array of objects.

subquestions.exam_section: SECTION 1 — SOFTWARE DESIGN AND DEVELOPMENT — 35 marks
subquestions.description: Complete the logic for a bubble sort algorithm to arrange data in descending order.

subquestions.exam_section: SECTION 1 — SOFTWARE DESIGN AND DEVELOPMENT — 35 marks
subquestions.description: Explain the concept of inheritance by referring to relationships between classes in a UML diagram.

subquestions.exam_section: SECTION 1 — SOFTWARE DESIGN AND DEVELOPMENT — 35 marks
subquestions.description: Identify the object-oriented feature where a subclass overrides a method from its superclass.

subquestions.exam_section: SECTION 1 — SOFTWARE DESIGN AND DEVELOPMENT — 35 marks
subquestions.description: Design an algorithm using pseudocode to extract a unique list of values from an array of records.

subquestions.exam_section: SECTION 1 — SOFTWARE DESIGN AND DEVELOPMENT — 35 marks
subquestions.description: Complete the logic for an insertion sort algorithm to arrange local authority names in alphabetical order.

subquestions.exam_section: SECTION 1 — SOFTWARE DESIGN AND DEVELOPMENT — 35 marks
subquestions.description: Design an algorithm using pseudocode to calculate and store average values rounded to the nearest integer.

subquestions.exam_section: SECTION 1 — SOFTWARE DESIGN AND DEVELOPMENT — 35 marks
subquestions.description: Design a complex algorithm that uses binary search to find data and displays the results in a diagram.

subquestions.exam_section: SECTION 2 — DATABASE DESIGN AND DEVELOPMENT — 20 marks
subquestions.description: Draw an entity-relationship diagram indicating cardinality, participation, and whether entities are strong or weak.

subquestions.exam_section: SECTION 2 — DATABASE DESIGN AND DEVELOPMENT — 20 marks
subquestions.description: Identify a potential problem with a primary key and suggest a resolution to ensure uniqueness.

subquestions.exam_section: SECTION 2 — DATABASE DESIGN AND DEVELOPMENT — 20 marks
subquestions.description: Identify the type of maintenance required to ensure software compatibility with updated web technologies.

subquestions.exam_section: SECTION 2 — DATABASE DESIGN AND DEVELOPMENT — 20 marks
subquestions.description: Evaluate the effectiveness of using a Gantt chart for task scheduling and resource management.

subquestions.exam_section: SECTION 2 — DATABASE DESIGN AND DEVELOPMENT — 20 marks
subquestions.description: Complete an SQL CREATE TABLE statement including data types, foreign keys, and validation constraints.

subquestions.exam_section: SECTION 2 — DATABASE DESIGN AND DEVELOPMENT — 20 marks
subquestions.description: Rewrite an SQL WHERE clause using Advanced Higher logical operators like BETWEEN.

subquestions.exam_section: SECTION 2 — DATABASE DESIGN AND DEVELOPMENT — 20 marks
subquestions.description: Explain how query results are generated by referencing subqueries, the EXISTS operator, and the HAVING clause.

subquestions.exam_section: SECTION 2 — DATABASE DESIGN AND DEVELOPMENT — 20 marks
subquestions.description: Complete an SQL query using aggregate functions, grouping, and search criteria to produce a specified output.

subquestions.description: Identify the role of a development team member in conducting component testing.

subquestions.exam_section: SECTION 2 — DATABASE DESIGN AND DEVELOPMENT — 20 marks
subquestions.description: Identify the role of an existing customer in conducting end-user or usability testing.

subquestions.description: Explain the effect of CSS code that uses media queries to change image width based on viewport size.

subquestions.description: Explain the use of the mysqli_num_rows() function in a server-side script to check query results.

subquestions.description: Rewrite the logic for a PHP while loop to iterate through database query results.

subquestions.description: Write a PHP echo statement to display database results within HTML table elements.

subquestions.description: Identify the specific type of maintenance required to ensure software compatibility with updated web technologies.

subquestions.description: Evaluate the use of a Gantt chart for scheduling development tasks and managing project resources.

subquestions.description: Write HTML statements using name and value attributes to implement a form drop-down list.

subquestions.description: Write server-side PHP and HTML code to display output based on values previously selected by a user.

subquestions.description: Write PHP code to connect to a database and extract specific values based on a query.

subquestions.description: Explain how the results of a database query are used to dynamically populate an HTML drop-down list.

subquestions.description: Identify the specific type of testing undertaken by a member of the development team.
